As you know, I've been buying books to host a monthly mystery paperback giveaway. Some of the books are signed, some of them not. Most are by Indies. I'll drop a few hints below, but you won't know which paperback is up for grabs until you receive it in the mail.

To enter December's giveaway, all you have to do is heart this post and share into your stories. Leave a comment telling me your current fave read. That's it!

A little about December's mystery giveaway:
A Pride and Prejudice Mafia Retelling
Omnibus

Open Internationally. One winner.
One winner will be chosen before the next giveaway is posted. They will be contacted privately. Thank you for all the love and support you've given me through the years. I really love to give back. It makes me happy to be able to brighten someones day with a new book.

Good luck and happy reading!

BOOK 13 is DONE! TELL ME WHAT YOU WANT is coming soon! It will be my next book release! #igreads #newadultromance #comingsoon #romancewriter #luciafranco #spicybookstagram #indieauthorsofinstagram #hatersgonnahate

𝗚𝗨𝗬𝗦! 𝗕𝗢𝗢𝗞 𝟭𝟯 𝗜𝗦 𝗗𝗢𝗡𝗘!

𝗧𝗘𝗟𝗟 𝗠𝗘 𝗪𝗛𝗔𝗧 𝗬𝗢𝗨 𝗪𝗔𝗡𝗧 is coming!

I'm honestly shocked I wrote another book lol I LOVE surprising myself! Makes me feel like I'm on top of the world when I accomplish a personal challenge. You're your only competition <3

OH AND GUESS WHAT. It's a 𝗧𝗥𝗨𝗘 standalone! This book is so different from anything I've ever written. I'm oddly excited for you to read a more tender story and not something where you're suffocating on angst. Dare I say I wrote 𝗮 𝗰𝗶𝗻𝗻𝗮𝗺𝗼𝗻 𝗵𝗲𝗿𝗼? And I actually like him? WHO AM I?! 𝗡𝗘𝗪 𝗰𝗵𝗮𝗿𝗮𝗰𝘁𝗲𝗿𝘀 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗮 𝗡𝗘𝗪 𝘀𝘁𝗼𝗿𝘆 𝗶𝘀 𝗰𝗼𝗺𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝘆𝗼𝘂𝗿 𝘄𝗮𝘆! 𝗡𝗘𝗪 𝗰𝗼𝘃𝗲𝗿 𝘁𝗼𝗼!

A little book 𝘂𝗽𝗱𝗮𝘁𝗲 as I know there's some confusion with my release dates and which book(s) is next.

Last year I wrote the first book in Xavier and Avery's duet, 𝗪𝗛𝗔𝗧'𝗦 𝗟𝗘𝗙𝗧 𝗢𝗙 𝗨𝗦. 𝗜𝘁'𝘀 𝗱𝗼𝗻𝗲! It’s about 350 pages. Despite having a preorder and a release date at one point, I have not published it. I had to put that book aside to work on 𝗧𝗛𝗘 𝗕𝗘𝗔𝗨𝗧𝗜𝗙𝗨𝗟 𝗔𝗡𝗗 𝗧𝗛𝗘 𝗗𝗔𝗠𝗡𝗘𝗗 (𝗕𝗗) since it was part of a project I was involved in. After my dad's passing, I got behind on all my publishing projects and every book release date has since been pushed back. BD was pulled from the project so I could finish writing it at a pace that also allows me to grieve. During this time I was inspired to change the title of BD due to the direction the story was going. Normally I don't change titles after I announce them but I felt compelled to with this book. 𝗧𝗵𝗲 𝗻𝗲𝘄 𝘁𝗶𝘁𝗹𝗲 𝗳𝗼𝗿 𝗕𝗗 𝗶𝘀 𝗧𝗘𝗟𝗟 𝗠𝗘 𝗪𝗛𝗔𝗧 𝗬𝗢𝗨 𝗪𝗔𝗡𝗧, 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝘁𝗵𝗶𝘀 𝗯𝗼𝗼𝗸 𝘄𝗶𝗹𝗹 𝗯𝗲 𝗺𝘆 𝗻𝗲𝘅𝘁 𝗿𝗲𝗹𝗲𝗮𝘀𝗲.

Xavier and Avery are still coming! As soon as TMWYW is out, I'm diving into revisions and will publish their first book right after.

There will be no preorders for these titles. They will both be going straight into Kindle Unlimited. I don't have new release dates yet, but when I do and they're solid, I will share. I hope this clears up any confusion! Leave the questions in the comments if you have them.

"𝘗𝘭𝘦𝘢𝘴𝘦, 𝘴𝘸𝘦𝘦𝘵𝘩𝘦𝘢𝘳𝘵, 𝘱𝘶𝘵 𝘮𝘦 𝘰𝘶𝘵 𝘰𝘧 𝘮𝘺 𝘧𝘶𝘤𝘬𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘮𝘪𝘴𝘦𝘳𝘺 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘫𝘶𝘴𝘵 𝘴𝘢𝘺 𝘺𝘦𝘴 𝘢𝘭𝘳𝘦𝘢𝘥𝘺. 𝘚𝘢𝘺 𝘺𝘦𝘴 𝘵𝘰 𝘧𝘰𝘳𝘦𝘷𝘦𝘳 𝘸𝘪𝘵𝘩 𝘮𝘦." -𝙅𝙖𝙢𝙚𝙨 𝙍𝙞𝙫𝙞𝙚𝙧𝙖, 𝙎𝙖𝙮 𝙔𝙚𝙨

"𝘔𝘢𝘬𝘦 𝘭𝘰𝘷𝘦 𝘵𝘰 𝘮𝘦."
"𝘐 𝘢𝘭𝘳𝘦𝘢𝘥𝘺 𝘵𝘰𝘭𝘥 𝘺𝘰𝘶, 𝘴𝘸𝘦𝘦𝘵𝘩𝘦𝘢𝘳𝘵. 𝘐'𝘷𝘦 𝘣𝘦𝘦𝘯 𝘮𝘢𝘬𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘭𝘰𝘷𝘦 𝘵𝘰 𝘺𝘰𝘶 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘸𝘩𝘰𝘭𝘦 𝘵𝘪𝘮𝘦."

"𝘖𝘯𝘦 𝘥𝘢𝘺," 𝘑𝘢𝘮𝘦𝘴 𝘸𝘩𝘪𝘴𝘱𝘦𝘳𝘴, 𝘩𝘪𝘴 𝘣𝘳𝘦𝘢𝘵𝘩 𝘩𝘪𝘵𝘤𝘩𝘪𝘯𝘨. "𝘐'𝘮 𝘨𝘰𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘵𝘰 𝘮𝘢𝘬𝘦 𝘺𝘰𝘶 𝘮𝘺 𝘸𝘪𝘧𝘦, 𝘈𝘶𝘣𝘳𝘦𝘺. 𝘐 𝘩𝘰𝘱𝘦 𝘺𝘰𝘶'𝘳𝘦 𝘳𝘦𝘢𝘥𝘺 𝘣𝘦𝘤𝘢𝘶𝘴𝘦 𝘐'𝘮 𝘯𝘰𝘵 𝘵𝘢𝘬𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘯𝘰 𝘧𝘰𝘳 𝘢𝘯 𝘢𝘯𝘴𝘸𝘦𝘳."

𝗛𝗔𝗣𝗣𝗬 𝗩𝗔𝗟𝗘𝗡𝗧𝗜𝗡𝗘𝗦 𝗗𝗔𝗬, 𝗳𝗿𝗶𝗲𝗻𝗱𝘀! Those are some of the most popular highlighted quotes from Say Yes.

I may be the least sappiest person around, but I really really love valentines day so 𝗜'𝗺 𝗴𝗶𝘃𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗮𝘄𝗮𝘆 𝗮𝗻 𝗮𝘂𝗱𝗶𝗼𝗯𝗼𝗼𝗸 𝗼𝗳 𝗦𝗔𝗬 𝗬𝗘𝗦! It's one of my favorite holidays even though I never celebrate it. lol I think I like the idea that love is in the air. It makes me giddy.

All you have to do to get your hands on an audiobook copy of Say Yes is to tell a friend and share the post. Then let me know in the comments that you did!

I can't give away James and not Kova.

You can now read the extra spicy Hollywood Romance for $2.99 or free with Kindle Unlimited! You're Mine Tonight is a 200 page short story and prequel to We Own Tonight.

Here's a little preview from our main girl, Roxy.

I’m a lover and a player, a Hollywood socialite with a reputation I strive to live up to. But when I meet Brody, my soul ignites with an ombré of colors. The tortured artist is a dangerous addiction, and the perfect companion to my party girl ways.

Then I meet River at an audition to play his co-star. He’s a slow burn that soothes my reckless heart. His reserve calls out to me as it teeters on the edge. And the connection and chemistry we find in front of the cameras continues off screen.

One asks me to be his for the night.

The other just takes me.

Each man brings me to new heights and sparks an awareness deep inside of me. And now I want to make them both mine.

The only problem?
One has to remain a dirty little secret.

Today is the last day of Lupus Awareness Month.⁣
⁣
I debated if I wanted to post about lupus awareness month or not since I talk about lupus in my Insta stories often. Some days I get self-conscious about it because I feel like I come across complaining, but you show me that it’s okay to be open, and that I’m not alone in the fight. From the bottom of my heart, thank you for this. I’ve learned that by being vocal about the lupus life has actually helped many of you suffering from auto immune diseases too. Knowing that is why I continue to talk about it. Helping you, helps me. And I love helping people. Teamwork makes the dream work.
⁣
I fully understand why lupus people refer to themselves as warriors. It’s a battle every single day. It’s mentally exhausting. My hips ache a lot, my spine throbs, and I can’t seem to catch a good, deep breath. I want to cry all the time. It honestly fucking sucks.⁣
⁣
Lately when I’ve been feeling down and out, I find myself looking up to my favorite character to draw inspiration from. We all have that one fictional character that inspires us, and oddly enough, Adrianna. I tell myself, if she can do it, I can do it too.
⁣
People say authors put a little of themselves in every book they write. But I’d like to think it was Adrianna who gave me a little piece of herself. And I’m not talking about the lupus. I’m talking about her strength and resilience. Her passion and will of steel. Her tenancy to never give up and go after a dream. She showed me what to expect with this disease and how to take care of myself. Also what not to do. I think in some strange way the universe was preparing me for what came and it’s why I had to write the Off Balance series all those years ago. I learned a lot from her.⁣
⁣
We get one life. I want to make mine matter like she did. We’re in this together, my AI friends. 💜

HAPPY BOOK BIRTHDAY, JOHNNY & ALYSSA! 

Eight years ago I published my second book, Hold On to Me, a small-town coming of age romance. It brings all the feels and frustrating emotions of a single teen mom and a guy who is going through his own turmoil of losing his best friend. This is still one of my favorite stories I’ve written to date.

I’ll never forget the day I published Johnny and Alyssa’s story. My dad kept texting me to hurry up and come over for a pool party he was having. I was so late (as usual) and he wanted to hang out. I remember yelling (in a joking way) that I’m publishing a book and to give me a minute and I’ll be there. I pressed publish then went and had a few drinks with my dad. That feels like a lifetime ago now.

ICYMI: I’ve spoken about rewriting this book into first person (from third) for a while. It’s officially been done, but it also needs revisions. I expect to release it sometime next year.

No one will ever understand what I need the way Kova does.

He’s everything to me. My coach. My confidant. My weakness. I need the way he pushes me to my limits.

He broke me. Every touch was filled with lies. Every touch between us made me want more.

He promised me my dreams only to take them away.

Happy Monday!

It's a new week, which means new goals I can't wait to crush. I hope the same for you!

Last week I made significant revisions to Hold On To Me. I'm currently rewriting it from third-person omniscient to first-person. It's been a challenge to see how creative I can get swapping the point of view while not changing the story. It's fun seeing what I come up with. I slayed last week's goal and want to see if I can top myself this week.

What I love most about this project is seeing how far I've come in my writing career. I published this book in 2015. My writing styles are so different now. It's often hard for me to feel growth until I see it before me, and this book is proof of that. I'm proud of past me for having the courage and confidence to publish a romance book. I wouldn't be where I am today if I wasn't my biggest cheerleader. You have to root for yourself.

Revisions should be done by the time I release Tell Me What You Want. I consider this to be like a palate cleanser before I dive into Xavier and Avery's book. I'm so excited for their story.

Hold On To Me will rerelease late fall. Rewriting this story has been a huge goal of mine for a couple of years. I'm so freaking happy I'm close to accomplishing it.

Shop Update:

I have a few updates that are coming to my store I want to share.

I'm currently waiting on replacement books from Barnes and Noble. Out of the nearly forty that were damaged, I've only gotten six back so far. When I get them all delivered, I will have one last sale for all original paperbacks, hardcover volumes, and discounted books. I'll make sure to let you know the time and day in advance as this will be the very last sale of those books I do.

Unfortunately I have to update shipping costs on my website. I will no longer be shipping orders through media mail, and will be upgrading to priority or ground shipping. This ensures that your tracking numbers will be properly updated, and the package will get to you sooner.

The preorder for the (new) discreet pink Hush, Hush paperback is ending soon. This cover is so pretty in person! Each order comes with three custom stickers that are not for sale yet.

I hope you're having a good week! I'm already ahead of my weekly writing goal. I'm on a roll and can't stop. I can't wait to see where I end on Friday.

“Is it weird that I think it’s sort of hot that you just got out of jail?”

My brows shoot up, heat rushing to my cheeks. “I figured that would keep women away.”

“It does the opposite. At least in my opinion.” Her gaze bores into mine. “For one, it’s you, and two, girls love a bad boy. It’s the danger, the intrigue. Instant attraction.”

I laugh as if she’s telling a joke. But she’s not laughing.

“You’re kidding,” I deadpan.

She continues to stare at me. I suddenly feel hot, and I can’t tell if it’s the wine or her that’s making me feel clammy.

“I’m not. Girls love bad boys.” She leans in close and says, “And they want to be the one to tame them too.”

I’m living a double life.

During the day, I help women gain their confidence and look their best.

On the weekends, I encourage women to embrace their sexuality on the darker side of the web.

After all, sex is beauty.

When my older brother’s best friend appears at my family’s cabin the night I’m filming an episode, I’m surprised to see him. It’s been six years since Reed vanished from my life.

After learning where he’s been and why, I offer him an opportunity to start over. Reed is reluctant. He’s on probation, loyal to my brother, and doesn’t want to do anything to jeopardize his freedom.

So we agree that his identity will remain a secret and that my brother will never find out.

Since I'm working on edits for the next James and Aubrey story, I wanted to share this again since it's been a while.

Readers often ask after reading Hush, Hush, where I got the idea from. The entire story was inspired by this image of two young women sitting in the back of a limousine.

I was instantly in love. I'd been looking for photos on a stock site to promote Balance when I came across this picture. My jaw dropped, my heart fluttered, and all these scenes appeared in my head. I bought it immediately and then sent it to my editor Nadine with an idea. We had a blurb and a plot in less than twenty minutes. I didn't write the story for a few years, allowing it to marinate in my head since I was so deep in the Off Balance series.

What they say is true - a picture is worth a thousand words. In my case, it's worth over 200k words... AND A PUBLISHING DEAL. *cue the happy, grateful tears* I still can't believe my books are going to be in bookstores everywhere soon. THANK YOU FOR LOVING JAMES AND AUBREY AS MUCH AS ME!!!! Also, thank you for loving Natalie too <3 We can't forget about her.

Today I'm giving away a box of originals from the Off Balance series <3 This box contains the very first edition of Balance and Execution in paperback and audio. Also included is a glass mug with the letters K A on one side and Malysh on the other. The paperbacks and audios are also the original story before I rewrote the series.

I'm often asked why the rest of the books in the series don't have these covers. 

The covers changed when the series was extended from three books to five. At that point, I didn't feel like the colorful design matched the angsty storyline anymore. It was giving Young Adult, and this series is far from that. I had a new photoshoot done, went for a darker design, and added Release and Twist to the reading order.
